ComputationMethod: Number of species in the area ÷ total number of individuals in the area = biodiversity index
Concept: Crop diversity loss threatens global food security, as the world's human population depends on a diminishing number of varieties of a diminishing number of crop species
DataSource: Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry and Biosecurity.
Definition: Crop diversity index is the average number of varieties planted of crops (Fruits and vegetables) by province through traditional agricultural practices, focusing on disaster rick reduction and climate change adaptation.
Dissaggregation:
* types of cultivated crop
* Area Council Level
* Rural/Urban
* Provincial Level
* National Level
Rationale: It is central to food security. It underpins today’s production and provides the raw material needed for ensuring continuing supplies tomorrow, in the face of a rapidly changing world
TargetDescription: VNSO assistance required for understanding baseline on crop diversity
graph_title: Crop diversity index with a focus on fruit and vegetables (average number of varieties planted of crops by province)
